lead_paragraph: A member of a taxi drivers’ association has sought a court ruling on whether the oaths of office comply with new guidelines from Beijing.

byline.contributor: Didi Kirsten Tatlow contributed reporting from Beijing.
byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and ALAN WONG

headline.print_headline: 8 More Hong Kong Lawmakers May Lose Seats
headline.main: 8 More Pro-Democracy Lawmakers in Hong Kong May Lose Seats

snippet: A member of a taxi drivers’ association has sought a court ruling on whether the oaths of office comply with new guidelines from Beijing....
abstract: Hong Kong's High Court receives request for review of Legislative Council's decision to accept oaths of office from six pro-democracy lawmakers, and to allow two others to retake their oaths after theirs were rejected; Chinese government blocked lawmakers Sixtus Leung and Yau Wai-ching from assuming their seats on council after they pledged loyalty to 'Hong Kong Nation.'
